idea-plugin.name: Solarized Chandrian Themes
idea-plugin.description:
Adds Solarized Black, Dark, and Light Chandrian color themes.
Derived from 4lex4's Intellij Solarized themes for Intellij: https://github.com/4lex4/intellij-platform-solarized and from narenranjit's VSCode Theme Chandrian: https://github.com/narenranjit/chandrian-theme

Notable features:
  • High quality and consistent both the UI and editor schemes with an adaptation of minor colors (for the supported IDE version) avoiding any usage of Default or Darcula colors
  • Usage of inheritance mechanism to achieve unified look and feel between various languages (so, for example, syntax highlighting for such statically typed languages as Java, Kotlin, C#, Go or C++ and so on is as similar as possible and the same for the other kinds of languages)


To install:
  1. Go to Settings | Plugins, find the theme plugin and install it
  2. Restart the IDE
  3. Go to Settings | Appearance & Behavior | Appearance and select Solarized Light Chandrian or Solarized Dark Chandrian or Solarized Black Chandrian in the Theme dropdown
    • Or to select only an editor scheme go to Settings | Editor | Color Scheme and select Solarized Light Chandrian or Solarized Dark Chandrian or Solarized Black Chandrian in the Scheme dropdown
